reviewDescription: After my cancer treatments (tonsils) my teeth are crazy sensitive so I try a *lot* of these.As with other Sensodyne products, this helps sensitivity to hot or cold foods and drinks.the taste is good, and from what it says it should help deteriorated enamel .While It is not a strong whitening paste as other brands but a lot of their products aren't ( because - sensitivity) if that's fine with you then this is an excellent choice!

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2021

reviewDescription: I have used different versions of Sensodyne Pronamel for over a year now.  My go to is Intensive enamel repair because I like to think that is helping my teeth more.  I eat a lot of acidic foods and like the idea that it helps protect my teeth.  I also choose to use it in my house because my daughter's dentist recommended it for her teeth.Sensodyne has become a brand that I trust.This toothpaste is the Arctic Breeze flavor which is new to me.  It took a little time to get used to.  It is a strong flavor that lingers in my mouth after I have brushed my teeth.  It is a good strong flavor.  Definitely want to eat breakfast before brushing teeth.I have been using this brand for over a year though not this particular flavor.  Most often it is the Intensive Enamel repair  with whitening.  I feel my teeth are not as sensitive.  I also feel that my teeth are a good shade of white.  Whiter than other brands that I have used in the past.
reviewTitle: Good strong flavor.  Keeps my teeth whiter nicely.

reviewDescription: I had some work done on my teeth so they’re very sensitive. Sensodyne is a brand that my dentist recommended to me and one that I’ve been using for a couple years now. I love that this version has not only enamel repair but also teeth whitening. The toothpaste flavor is arctic breeze, it reminds me of a minty flavor but it's slightly different to the typical mint flavor you’ll find in most toothpaste. This toothpaste leaves a great clean and fresh feeling after brushing. I noticed that the toothpaste flavor lingers longer than most toothpaste and it leaves my breath smelling better longer. This toothpaste has a screw top and not a flip top but the top is flat so you can have the toothpaste sitting upright.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2021

reviewDescription: I have weak spots in my teeth that may need bonded someday. Sensodyne is the only toothpaste I trust to stop my teeth from getting sensitive. It has repaired damage and tooth sensitivity in other my teeth. It also keeps my teeth white and bright! I will never use anything else!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2021

reviewDescription: Enamel strengthener and desensitizer; the way these toothpastes work is by filling in the tiny tubules (microscopic channels)  in the teeth with potassium ions that desensitize the nerve.  So what about "enamel strengthening" and "whitener"  5% potassium nitrate is your desensitizer, and sodium fluoride  is what they mean by "strengthen enamel) and the ingredient 5% Pentasodium triphosphate is the destainer.So if you had in past to be choosing a sensitive tooth product over whitener.. you can use this to do the entire thing. I like Colgate Optic White but a desensitizer is best when I have a cranky tooth.
reviewTitle: A bit of everything you need
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2021

reviewDescription: My mom uses this because she had really sensitive teeth. This keeps her teeth from being sensitive. It has a nice mint flavor. She hasn't noticed any whitening effect. I recommend.

reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2021

reviewDescription: After using this toothpaste for a few days now, I can make several very clear observations:1.  The "whitening," if it works, takes longer than a few days.  I've noticed zero difference in before/after pictures.  But that's OK - I don't mind if my teeth are tea stained.2.  I have no idea if my enamel has been repaired.  Maybe it works, maybe it doesn't.  I have no way of telling.3.  It works as well as other Sensodyne products for teeth sensitive to hot, cold, and sweet stuff.  So for me, we have a winner.  And hopefully, in the process, my enamel is getting all fixed up.Sensodyne makes a similar product that's not for the US market (likely because of FDA restrictions) that appears to be the same product, but with something that they marketing team named "Novamax" or something like that.  I'm curious what the actual difference there is, and if it's a better but not-yet-or-maybe-ever allowed product for the US market.Overall - a good product, the tubes are kind of small making it more expensive that most other toothpastes (even premium ones), but for sensitive teeth, you can't go wrong!  Makes your mouth and teeth feel sparkly clean, too!
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2021

reviewDescription: I have to admit that I like this toothpaste more than I thought I would. I've been using it consistently for a week now, and my tooth sensitivity has really decreased. Though it can be a little intense as I'm brushing (almost akin to the feeling you get when swishing something like Listerine), it hasn't caused any sores, irritations, or skin peeling. My teeth also seem to be a little bit whiter - it's not super-noticeable, by any means, but I do see a small change. Additionally, it makes my teeth and mouth, as a whole, feel cleaner and fresher for longer than a lot of the other toothpastes that I've tried.As for the enamel repairing benefits, I can't say that I've noticed anything, but I'm not entirely sure that that's something that one could notice outside of a dental appointment.So, aside from the aforementioned intensity that's not ideal, this is a good toothpaste, and I do recommend it.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2021

reviewDescription: I have tooth sensitivity and was pleasantly surprised by the decrease in sensitivity I experienced when biting into cold foods after using this toothpaste for a short period of time. I probably haven't used it long to enough to comment on its whitening capabilities, but it does taste very minty and fresh. This is one of the best flavored toothpastes I've tried. My only issue is the cost. This toothpaste is quite expensive compared to Colgate or Crest, and the tubes are small. I will probably mix in this toothpaste along with my normal toothpaste to keep costs down.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2021

reviewDescription: + For sensitive teeth+ Easy to use tube- Flavour----------------------------------------------I genuinely believed that Sensodyne was tooting their own horn a little much, but was shocked that during my first brush with this toothpaste... I didn't wince in pain. There is a section of teeth that I always had to skim over due to their sensitivity, but that wasn't an issue this time. As I haven't used this product long enough, I can't give an opinion on its whitening effects, but I will update in a month or so - or if there is noticeable change.In regards to the flavour, I'm not a big fan. I can't describe it, but it's... not the best. Compared to other mint products, this one is unusual. Of course, it could just be a "me" problem.
reviewTitle: Sensitivity resolved from the first brush... honestly amazed.
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2021

reviewDescription: The Seneodyne pronamel intensive enamel repaied whitening toothpaste is slightly less foamy than ordinary toothpaste, but I really like that after using it, the teeth and mouth can remain very cool fresh for a while even after drinking coffee, it is very comfortable. I can get rid of bad mouth odor without using mouthwash. After brushing, the teeth are very clean, and they are not very bleed from the gums. The teeth are indeed whiter a lot, and I have studied the ingredients containing titanium dioxide, so this white may be false white. The potassium nitrate is used to effectively reduce gum allergies. This ingredient is a relieving effect and not a cure. After I use it for a while, my gums will still be uncomfortable. The relieved effect may disappear, so I have to apply a little toothpaste on the uncomfortable gums to reduce discomfort. And children under the age of 12 should not use it.
reviewTitle: Fresh flavor and relieved the sensitive gum

reviewDescription: If you search here on Amazon for Sensodyne, you will find no less than 20 varieties.....Is all that really necessary?  I have 4 of them with the last one being their "boost"  To me, they all seem the same.  Nothin was boosted more than any other version.  I was HOPING that this version contained their NOVAMIN, but it does not.  Apparently, they can't make claims and market that here because of the FDA.  Well, Sensodyne, here is an idea:  DONT MARKET IT, just quietly add it.  Reformulate your "Boost" paste by boosting it with Novamin.  Then let the reviews speak for you.  problem solved.  Why let the American public suffer??The paste is ok, it is just not what I was hoping for.  I don't know how many people are really interested in feeling an Arctic Breeze on their sensitive teeth though.  Honestly, the flavor is ok, just an odd name for a sensitive toothpaste.
reviewTitle: disapponted with Sensodyne, USA  this does not contain Novamin

reviewDescription: I’ve tried three different versions of sensodyne toothpaste.  I like this one’s flavor, not too strong, but refreshing.  I also like that it doesn’t get foamy in the mouth like the complete version.  The foamy ones are harder to fully spit out.  The cap is okay, but a little harder to put back on than the complete version.  I do wish that GSK would use tamper proof packaging; either a peel away cap cover or glue the box shut.  I can never tell if whitening toothpastes ever truly work.  Sensodyne is not gritty like some whitening toothpaste brands.  There are so many options, it’s difficult to choose.

reviewDescription: The Sensodyne Pronamel intensive enamel repair whitening toothpaste is made for those with teeth that are sensitive to temperature, acids, sweets, and contact by actively repairing weakened enamel.  This toothpaste also whitens and works to prevent cavities.I use this toothpaste just like any other, and it works fine.  I don’t experience tooth sensitivity often, and my teeth are a normal shade.  The arctic breeze flavor is mild and refreshing, unlike other brands of toothpaste I’ve used with strong flavors.  After using this toothpaste over the past month, I don’t notice any changes.  My tooth enamel probably doesn’t need to be repaired.As a coffee drinker, I am concerned about staining my teeth and making them darker.  I don’t notice any difference with my teeth color, and my dentist recently confirmed my shade was normal.  Whiter teeth would be nice, but I’m more concerned with fighting stains.I don’t normally use Sensodyne toothpaste but have no concerns about doing so.  This toothpaste works as well as my normal whitening brand.  If you have sensitive teeth, perhaps the Sensodyne Pronamel intensive enamel repair whitening toothpaste is right for you.► PROS:Protects teethReduces sensitivityWhitensRefreshing flavor► CONS:None I could find
reviewTitle: Cool Flavor: A Sensodyne Pronamel Intensive Enamel Repair Whitening Toothpaste Review
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2021

reviewDescription: Cheap
reviewedIn: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2022

reviewDescription: 3 Month Update: I was having some spots show up on my teeth a month or two after switching over to this. I thought it was just part of getting old or something. At my dentist appointment the other day they told me they were stains and polished those spots right off. I'm still leaving this at 4 stars because it did work amazing for my sensitivity, but it just doesn't have enough abrasive in it to keep stains at bay.-----I have not noticed my teeth getting any whiter, but they are pretty white already (I don't drink coffee or anything) and the flavor is alright. I mean, it's toothpaste.However, when it comes to tooth sensitivity, holy cow, I am a Sensodyne convert. I'm in my mid-30's and started to notice that my teeth were sensitive to ice water, cold grapes, really anything that came out of the fridge. It wasn't painful per se, just really uncomfortable and I winced every time I'd take a sip or I'd gotten used to eating cold food on one side of my mouth that was less sensitive.2 days with Sensodyne and I noticed an immediate difference. I've been using it for a couple of months now (twice a day, I'm nearly through my first tube) and it's gotten even a bit better. I can still tell which teeth aren't thrilled about cold temps, but it's knocked the severity or uncomfortableness down from about a 6 out of 10 to a 2 out of 10.I was impressed there was such a large change in such a short amount of time. I expected a slow change over months, so I was more than excited when just a few days in I could chug ice water when I came in from mowing the lawn in the July heat. If you have teeth that are temperature sensitive, give this stuff a shot. it worked wonders for me.
reviewTitle: Mid-30's, Sensitive Teeth-- Immediate Difference in Just a Couple of Days

reviewDescription: I've been using Sensodyne Pronamel for a few years. It has helped with my sensitivity problem.  However, when it came time to re-order, I saw the 'Intensive Enamel Repair' version, which claims to 'REPAIR WEAKENED ENAMEL', so I ordered a supply. When they arrived, I inspected the product and discovered that it is the EXACT same active ingredients as the standard Sensodyne toothpaste: Potassium nitrate 5%, and Sodium fluoride 0.15% w/v fluoride?  This is identical to all the Sensodyne toothpastes I've used before. I called the 1-800 CS line and got to speak to a 'rep'(?) who had no knowledge of what I wanted to know. So, to all potential buyers, know that the 'SENSODYNE INTENSIVE ENAMEL REPAIR' is no different than the rest! Very misleading advertising.
reviewTitle: All Sensodyne Products have the exact same active ingredients.
